data_source: Web search (Hunter.io API blocked by network proxy)

primary_decision_maker.name: Jennifer Crossley
primary_decision_maker.title: Athletic Director
primary_decision_maker.notes: 2023 NEOIAAA Athletic Director of the Year. Deeply involved in facility planning. Quoted extensively in media about SPIRE scheduling conflicts. 7th CVC AD to win state award since 2017.
primary_decision_maker.project_involvement: Facility Planning Committee lead, presented stadium proposal to board

secondary_contacts.name: Dr. Paul Lombardo
secondary_contacts.title: Superintendent
secondary_contacts.notes: Started August 2025. Led bond levy presentations. Quoted: 'With no lights, there's just no way we'll be able to get all those practices in.' 30 years education experience.
secondary_contacts.project_involvement: District spokesperson for facility bond, final approval authority

secondary_contacts.name: Michele Krieg
secondary_contacts.title: Board President
secondary_contacts.notes: Board approval required for facility decisions. Noted scaled-back design excludes band shell, restrooms, concessions.

secondary_contacts.name: Shelley McDermott
secondary_contacts.title: District Treasurer
secondary_contacts.notes: Handles financial planning, presented bond financials, identified grants. Key for budget discussions.
secondary_contacts.project_involvement: Budget planning, grant identification, financial reporting

general_contact.address: 1301 S Ridge Rd E, Geneva, OH 44041

talking_points: Reference scaled-back $5.75M facility plan proceeding after bond failure
Address superintendent's quote about lighting need for practices
Offer energy efficient LED solutions that maximize tight budget
Position lighting as component that can be phased in via grants/donations
outreach_recommendations.email_subject_suggestion: LED Lighting Solutions for Geneva's New Athletic Facility

prospects.institution: School City of Mishawaka (Mishawaka High School)

primary_decision_maker.name: Evan Fras
primary_decision_maker.title: Director of Athletics
primary_decision_maker.notes: Hired June 2025, MHS Class of 2014 alum returning to alma mater. Previously Dean of Athletics at NorthWood HS. Quoted about T-Mobile contest and stadium upgrade needs. Bachelor's from IU Bloomington, Master's from Grace College.
primary_decision_maker.project_involvement: Led T-Mobile contest application, stadium upgrade advocate

secondary_contacts.name: John DeShone
secondary_contacts.title: Assistant Director of Athletics
secondary_contacts.notes: Also listed as Derrick DeShone in some sources. Key athletics staff member.

secondary_contacts.name: Jennifer Addison
secondary_contacts.title: Athletic Secretary
secondary_contacts.notes: Administrative contact, gatekeeper for athletics office

secondary_contacts.name: Chad Brugh
secondary_contacts.title: Principal
secondary_contacts.notes: School-level administration, may be involved in facility decisions

secondary_contacts.name: Sherry Keyser
secondary_contacts.title: Assistant Athletic Director
secondary_contacts.notes: BS from IU South Bend, former teacher at Mishawaka

outreach_recommendations.timing: Within 1 week - 100th anniversary creates natural upgrade moment
talking_points: Congratulate on T-Mobile Top 25 finalist status and $25K award
Connect LED lighting to their recent $1.5M Notre Dame-grade turf investment
Note his quote about accessibility, concessions, locker rooms, storage needs
Emphasize energy savings and modern controls
outreach_recommendations.email_subject_suggestion: Complete Steele Stadium's 100th Anniversary Upgrade with LED Lighting

primary_decision_maker.name: Troy Ferguson
primary_decision_maker.title: Athletic Director
primary_decision_maker.source: School website staff directory, news articles
primary_decision_maker.notes: National Trail alum, 21 years at district, 5th year as AD. Led T-Mobile contest application. Quoted: 'Being a Trail grad myself, this means a lot.' Emotionally invested in winning upgrade for students.
primary_decision_maker.project_involvement: T-Mobile contest lead, stadium renovation advocate

secondary_contacts.name: Jennifer S. Couch
secondary_contacts.title: Superintendent
secondary_contacts.notes: Appointed April 2024, former MS Principal. Quoted in media about T-Mobile contest: '$1M prize would go toward renovating the football field and stadium.' Completing superintendent certification via BGSU.

outreach_recommendations.approach: Call or email Troy Ferguson - high emotional investment evident
outreach_recommendations.timing: Within 2 weeks - T-Mobile contest voting ended Oct 24, results announced Oct 30
talking_points: Congratulate on being only Ohio school in T-Mobile Top 25
Reference AD Ferguson's 21-year commitment to district as alum
Address superintendent's commitment to stadium renovation
Offer flexible pricing for smaller district budget
Position as partner regardless of T-Mobile outcome
outreach_recommendations.email_subject_suggestion: LED Lighting Partner for National Trail's Stadium Renovation

summary.methodology: Hunter.io API blocked by network proxy. Used web search to verify contacts via official school websites, news articles, ZoomInfo public profiles, and staff directories.

immediate_outreach_priority.name: Jennifer Crossley
immediate_outreach_priority.rationale: 100% verified email, SPIRE deadline June 2027, award-winning AD, direct facility planning involvement

immediate_outreach_priority.name: Evan Fras
immediate_outreach_priority.rationale: 95% verified email, T-Mobile finalist, 100th anniversary motivation, recent investments show budget

immediate_outreach_priority.name: Troy Ferguson
immediate_outreach_priority.rationale: 90% verified email, only Ohio T-Mobile finalist, emotionally invested alum
